line.words: Babara al wè zanmi li yo pa Tom McWalter

subtitle.line: Barbara Visits her Friends By Tom McWalter
Barbara Visits her Friends By Tom McWalter

line.words: Babara te vle al wè zanmi li yo. Babara te gen yon zanmi ki rele Fègis, ki te rete nan tèt mòn nan, ak yon zanmi ki te rele Alfons, ki te rete nan mwatye mwatye wout pou al nan tèt mòn nan, bò kote yon rigòl.

subtitle.line: Barbara wanted to visit her friends. Barbara had a friend Fergus, who lived at the top of the mountain, and a friend Alfonse, who lived half way up the mountain, by a stream.
Barbara wanted to visit her friends. Barbara had a friend Fergus, who lived at the top of the mountain, and a friend Alfonse, who lived half way up the mountain, by a stream.

line.words: Manman Babara mande l “Kisa ou bezwen?”

subtitle.line: Barbara’s mother asked “What do you need?”
Barbara’s mother asked “What do you need?”

line.words: Premyèman Babara telefone Fègis. Bonjou Fègis. “Kijan ou wè tan an?” Fergus te di “Tan an lèd. Gen van epi nèj ap tonbe.”

subtitle.line: First Barbara phoned Fergus. “Hello Fergus. What’s the weather like?” Fergus said “It’s bad weather. It is windy and it is snowing.”
First Barbara phoned Fergus. “Hello Fergus. What’s the weather like?” Fergus said “It’s bad weather. It is windy and it is snowing.”

line.words: Babara mande §Ki tanperati l fè?§ Fègis reponn §Li fè mwens 10 degre, men fò ou menmen jip ou a.§

subtitle.line: “What is the temperature?” Barbara asked. “It is minus 10 degrees, but you must bring your skirt,” replied Fergus.
“What is the temperature?” Barbara asked. “It is minus 10 degrees, but you must bring your skirt,” replied Fergus.

line.words: Babara ale nan bifèt li a epi li rale chal li a, chapo l, gan l, manto l ak bòt li. Apre sa, li vin sonje jip la. Li pa t konn sa pou l te fè ak jip la men li pran l kanmenm.

subtitle.line: Barbara went back to her cupboard and took out her sun hat, sunglasses, t-shirt and shorts. Then she remembered the umbrella. She was puzzled about the umbrella but she took it anyway.
Barbara went back to her cupboard and took out her sun hat, sunglasses, t-shirt and shorts. Then she remembered the umbrella. She was puzzled about the umbrella but she took it anyway.

line.words: Lè sa a, Babara telefone Alfons. “Bonjou Alfons. Kijan ou wè tan an?“ “Tan an bèl e gen solèy, tanperati a 25 degre, men fò ou pot parapli ou.”

subtitle.line: Then Barbara phoned Alfonse. “Hello Alfonse. What’s the weather like?” “It’s fine and sunny, the temperature is 25 degrees, but you must bring your umbrella.”
Then Barbara phoned Alfonse. “Hello Alfonse. What’s the weather like?” “It’s fine and sunny, the temperature is 25 degrees, but you must bring your umbrella.”

line.words: Babara tounen nan bifèt li a e li pran chapo solèy li a, linèt solèy li, mayo li ak bout pantalon l. Apre sa, li vin sonje parapli a. Li pa t konn sa pou l te fè ak parapli a men li pran l kanmenm.

subtitle.line: Barbara went back to her cupboard and took out her sun hat, sunglasses, t-shirt and shorts. Then she remembered the umbrella. She was puzzled about the umbrella but she took it anyway.
Barbara went back to her cupboard and took out her sun hat, sunglasses, t-shirt and shorts. Then she remembered the umbrella. She was puzzled about the umbrella but she took it anyway.

line.words: Babara te fè kèk sandwich, li ranpli boutèy li ya ak dlo, epi li pati avèk sak lou li sou do l.

subtitle.line: Barbara made sandwiches, filled her water bottle and set off with her heavy rucksack.
Barbara made sandwiches, filled her water bottle and set off with her heavy rucksack.

line.words: Lè Babara rivekay Alfons la li wè yon awozwa nan jaden l lan ki t ap wouze plant li yo. Lè sa a, li konnen poukisa li te bezwen yon parapli, pou l te ka pa mouye lè t ap avanse pou l al nan pòt la.

subtitle.line: When Barbara got to Alfonse’s house she saw that the sprinkler was on in his garden, watering his plants. Now she knew why she needed an umbrella, to keep her dry while she walked to the front door.
When Barbara got to Alfonse’s house she saw that the sprinkler was on in his garden, watering his plants. Now she knew why she needed an umbrella, to keep her dry while she walked to the front door.

line.words: Li pataje yon sandwich ak Alfons epi yo ri ansanm apwopo de parapli a ke li te bezwen an, alòs ke gen yon bèl ti solèy. Babara di orevwa, epi li ale.

subtitle.line: She shared a sandwich with Alfonse and they laughed together about needing an umbrella on such a sunny day. Barbara said goodbye and set off.
She shared a sandwich with Alfonse and they laughed together about needing an umbrella on such a sunny day. Barbara said goodbye and set off.

line.words: Aprè yon moman li di §Li fè frèt!§ Alò li met manto li sou li.

subtitle.line: After a while she thought “It’s cold!” So she put on her coat.
After a while she thought “It’s cold!” So she put on her coat.

line.words: Lè l rive pi lwen nan mòn nan, li di §Li fè frèt anpil!§ Alò li met chapo li, gan l, bòt li ak chal la.

subtitle.line: Further up the mountain she thought “It’s freezing!” So she put on her hat, gloves, boots and scarf.
Further up the mountain she thought “It’s freezing!” So she put on her hat, gloves, boots and scarf.

line.words: Lè Babara rive kay Fègis, li wè yo te bati yon gwo iglou epi moun t ap dans. Se lè sa a li konprann poukisa li te bezwen vin ak jip li a.

subtitle.line: When Barbara got to Fergus’ house she saw that they had built a giant igloo and were having a dance. Now she knew why she had needed to bring her skirt.
When Barbara got to Fergus’ house she saw that they had built a giant igloo and were having a dance. Now she knew why she had needed to bring her skirt.

line.words: Li met jip li a sou li epi li antre nan dans la. Li pataje rès sandwich li yo ak moun yo epi yo tout pase yon bèl ti moman ansanm.

subtitle.line: She changed into her skirt and joined in the dance. She shared the rest of her sandwiches and they all had a wonderful time.
She changed into her skirt and joined in the dance. She shared the rest of her sandwiches and they all had a wonderful time.
